ygData.subject: CSTR: Ignitor Gaussian Pulse, Functors in Matlab
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello, I ve been having trouble getting an igniter gaussian pulse in a cotinually stirred reactor model in Matlab. The Reactors file from Cantera Workshop

Subject: CSTR: Ignitor Gaussian Pulse, Functors in Matlab
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=228646714; y=yP6U0_iDb5JyUD1Df1BLLaBuCU0Tc082HeATkkah1AqCgoQnfqjxMnrDhCw
X-Yahoo-Profile: bhupindersingh_99

Hello,

I've been having trouble getting an igniter gaussian pulse in a 
cotinually stirred
reactor model in Matlab.

The "Reactors" file from Cantera Workshop explains a Python 
example, which clearly uses a functor to get a gaussian pulse.

Python:
igniter_mdot = Gaussian(t0 = 1, FWHM = 0.2, A = 1) (Functor)
m3 = MassFlowController(upstream = igniter, downstream = 
combustor, mdot = igniter_mdot)

I'm trying to use a similar approach in Matlab.

Matlab:

igniter_mdot = @(t) Gaussian(t,0.01,1,0.2);
(Functor for Gaussian pulse)

igniter_controller = MassFlowController;
install(igniter_controller, igniter, combustor);
setMassFlowRate(igniter_controller, igniter_mdot);

(The Gaussian function, wasn't available in the Cantera 
distribution. I created my own Gaussian function.)

When I plot massFlowRate(igniter_controller,tim) vs tim I still 
see zero mass flow rate.

Initially, I wasn't sure how a functor works. So, I set up 
igniter_mdot to be an array of gaussian function values for 
discrete t values. That didn't work either.

I've struggled with this one for a long time. Need help with 
this.

Thank you,

Bhupinder
